Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

ListItem.name: LI_744745
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no additional primary site(s) present)

DisplayedItem.title: Please complete a separate checklist for each primary site if required as above.

ListItem.title: Squamous cell carcinoma, not otherwise specified

ListItem.title: Squamous cell carcinoma with sarcomatoid differentiation

ListItem.name: LI_744770
ListItem.title: Squamous cell carcinoma with osteoclast-like giant cells

ListItem.name: LI_744790
ListItem.title: II (carcinoma present in but does not fill and expand papillary dermis)

ListItem.name: LI_744791
ListItem.title: III (carcinoma fills and expands papillary dermis)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_771029
DisplayedItem.title: # Location of the involved nerve deep to the dermis serves as a surrogate for this size cut-off and qualifies as greater than or equal to 0.1 mm.

ListItem.name: LI_744853
ListItem.title: Greater than or equal to 0.1 mm in caliber#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_744853_1
Property.val: Greater than or equal to 0.1 mm in caliber

ListItem.title: All margins negative for invasive tumor

ListItem.title: All margins negative for in situ disease

ListItem.name: LI_744835
ListItem.title: In situ disease present at margin

ListItem.name: LI_744868
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_744871
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Question.title: Size of Largest Nodal Metastatic Deposit

Section.name: S_744921
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note H)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_745253
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_745253_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_745272
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_745260
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor smaller than or equal to 2 cm in greatest dimension

ListItem.name: LI_745265
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor larger than 2 cm, but smaller than or equal to 4 cm in greatest dimension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_745282
DisplayedItem.title: #Deep invasion is defined as invasion beyond the subcutaneous fat (i.e., to underlying microanatomic landmarks such as fascia, muscle, perichondrium, and / or periosteum) or greater than 6 mm (as measured from the granular layer of adjacent normal epidermis to the base of the tumor); perineural invasion for T3 classification is defined as tumor cells within the nerve sheath of a nerve lying deeper than the dermis or measuring 0.1 mm or larger in caliber, or presenting with clinical or radiographic involvement of named nerves without skull base invasion or transgression.

ListItem.name: LI_745266
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor larger than 4 cm in maximum dimension or minor bone erosion or perineural invasion or deep invasion#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_745268
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Tumor with gross cortical bone / marrow, skull base invasion and / or skull base foramen invasion

ListItem.name: LI_745283
ListItem.title: pT4a: Tumor with gross cortical bone / marrow invasion

ListItem.name: LI_745284
ListItem.title: pT4b: Tumor with skull base invasion and / or skull base foramen involvement

DisplayedItem.name: DI_772765
DisplayedItem.title: # A designation of “U” or “L” may be used for any N category to indicate metastasis above the lower border of the cricoid (U) or below the lower border of the cricoid (L). Similarly, clinical and pathological ENE should be recorded as ENE(−) or ENE(+).

ListItem.name: LI_758204
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_758205
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_745278
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_745275
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(-)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_745273
DisplayedItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or in bilateral or contralateral lymph node(s), none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension, ENE(-)

ListItem.name: LI_745274
ListItem.title: pN2a: Metastasis in single ipsilateral node 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or a single ipsilateral node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-)

ListItem.name: LI_745285
ListItem.title: pN2b: Metastases in multiple ipsilateral nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-)

ListItem.name: LI_745286
ListItem.title: pN2c: Metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph node(s), none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_745287
DisplayedItem.title: pN3: Metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or in a single ipsilateral node larger than 3 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral nodes, any with ENE(+); or a single contralateral node of any size and ENE(+)

ListItem.name: LI_745288
ListItem.title: pN3a: Metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-)

ListItem.name: LI_745289
ListItem.title: pN3b: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral node larger than 3 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral nodes, any with ENE(+); or a single contralateral node of any size and ENE(+)

ListItem.name: LI_745307
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_745307_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Section.name: S_745290
Section.title: Brigham and Women's (BWH) Tumor Classification System (Note H)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_745290_1
Property.val: Brigham and Women's (BWH) Tumor Classification System

ListItem.name: LI_745321
ListItem.title: Tumor diameter greater than or equal to 2 cm

ListItem.name: LI_745323
ListItem.title: Perineural invasion greater than or equal to 0.1 mm in caliber

ListItem.name: LI_745324
ListItem.title: Tumor invasion beyond subcutaneous fat (excluding bone invasion, which upgrades tumor to BWH stage T3)

ListItem.name: LI_745339
ListItem.title: T3: Greater than or equal to 4 risk factors or bone invasion

DisplayedItem.name: DI_744974
DisplayedItem.title: Biomarkers tested may be included in the section below. Pending biomarker studies may be listed in the Comments section of this report.

Section.name: S_758210
Section.title: Biomarkers Tested (may repeat for up to 10 biomarkers)
